column4: you see no LDM (gui) login screen? or is it there but not letting you login?
i can see the LDM, but when i try to enter with my login-password, i cannot enter
as a 'test' you could stop ldm with 'sudo service ldm stop' (from a console) then try 'startx' and see if that gets  you to the desktop
I tryied, it says: "ldm: unrecognized service"
if you are useing 'gdm' try gdm, if kdm, try kdm. just make sure your 'login screen' service is not running befor you try the startx command.
with ctrl+alt+f7 i can see login screen of Lubuntu, but in text mode, using ps aux, i not see ldm or gdm or kdm, do you want see the entire ps aux?
you may want to ask in #lubuntu how to stop their login service. I thought it was ldm. it may be called somthing differntly
you could look in /etc/init/ and see if theres a gdm.conf or ldm.conf of somthingelseDM.conf it may be using.
found lxdm, i'll try to stop it
found ok stopped lxdm, using startx (without sudo) there is this error "Error from xkbcomp are not fatal to the X server
so 'startx' is not even working for the user?
yes, startx not work for the user
as a second 'test' try making a new user. 'sudo adduser billgates' (or whoever) and login ont ot he console as them.. see if startx works for them.
i've created new user but startx not work
thats a sign of a deeper systemissue. not just a user setting. :( that can be much harder to figure out.
are you getting any sctual error messages with it? what does startx do exactly when youy try it.
sorry for delay, i'm trying to create a paste of errors
the 'pastebin' command does wonders. :)
this is the error http://paste.ubuntu.com/572993/
as another test try just running 'X' see if it has a dixplay with a X cursor..  somting seems really weird here.
when i use startx , there is no X cursor. there is only a line in black screen for a moment and after that message appear
no other ideas?
